entry.content:
Hi,

 

I need the master table name for the SAP IS-U system that stores city information, which I can use to validate incoming city names and postal codes.

entry.title: Logic For Item in Grouping
entry.content:
I‚Äôve been assigned to modify a program where the requirement is to display Profit Center and its corresponding Profit Center Name, under specific conditions.

Business Rule:

Group the data by FI Document Number (BELNR) first, then apply logic to retrieve the correct Profit Center Name based on the Profit Center values within the same document group.

Scenarios:

Case 1:
If all Profit Centers in the group share the same first 4 digits, strip the remaining digits of trailing zeros and use that to retrieve the Profit Center Name.

Case 2:
If the Profit Centers share the same first 2 digits, strip the rest of the digits of trailing zeros and retrieve the Profit Center Name.

Case 3:
If the Profit Centers are completely identical, then directly retrieve the Profit Center Name using that value.

Issue I‚Äôm Facing:

Right now, the program logic is executed per line item, which means it cannot determine if Profit Centers within the same FI Document group are similar or different. Therefore, it's difficult to apply the rules above correctly at the group level.

I would appreciate any suggestions or advice on how best to restructure or enhance the logic ‚Äî especially how to compare Profit Center values across grouped FI Documents in ABAP, or whether you‚Äôve handled a similar requirement before.

Thank you in advance üôè

entry.title: How to Make Attachment Mandatory Before Saving in VA01 (Sales Order Creation)?
entry.content:
Hi Experts,

One of my clients has a requirement to make it mandatory to attach a document before saving a sales order in VA01 and VA02.

I successfully implemented the check in VA02 by using the USEREXIT_SAVE_DOCUMENT_PREPARE in MV45AFZZ, where the sales order number is already available, and I could restrict the save based on the attachment check.

However, in VA01, since the sales order number is generated only after saving, I'm unable to validate whether an attachment is present before the document is saved.

Has anyone faced a similar scenario?
Is there a way to check for attachments or enforce this validation in VA01 before the sales order is created?
Any BADI or User Exit suggestions or workaround approaches would be highly appreciated.

Thanks in advance!

Best regards,

Mannem Leelamohan

i am using SAP GW service to develope the adobe form

Thanks

entry.title: To update REGUH-VALUDT based on individual invoice item amount REGUP-WRBTR <10k during F110
entry.content:
My requirement is to update REGUH-VALUDT for individual invoice item i.e REGUP-BELNR based on REGUP-WRBTR < 10k . This is during payment proposal. I have tried to implement BTE 1830 , but that does not trigger for each line item , hence could not use it.

Can someone suggest alternative BTE/Exits/BADI in SAP S/4 HANA on premise 1909 version which will fufill the above ask.

entry.title: deleting/moving PPM project tasks in the Completed status
entry.content:
Hello,

In a Maintanance project, sometimes I need to delete or move a Task around in the project structure but after getting the Completed status all changes are prohibited. We have ChaRM and PPM integration set up.
1. Can I customize the status scheme so that the Completed status can be canceled? I can't find such settings in spro.
2. Is there any report that allows deleting different tasks without archiving the whole project?

Any input is greatly appreciated.

Thank you )

entry.title: WorkCenter ALE IDOC Error - The (internal) unit HUR has not been maintained in the unit table
entry.content:
Hi all,

I'm currently working on ALE distribution of work centers from our DEV system to the QAS system. I've completed the necessary ALE configurations, including:

  • Sending System 

    • Message type: LOIWCS

    • IDoc type: LOIWCS03 (outbound)

  • Receiving System
    • Message type: LOIWCS

    • Inbound process code: WRKCTR,

    • linked to function module CR_IDOC_WRKCENTER_INBOUND

The IDoc is being triggered correctly using transaction POIM, but the work center is not being created in the receiving system. The issue arises because:

  • The fields KAPEH and MEINS in segment E1KAKOL are populated with the ISO code for the commercial unit of measure (UoM) HR. HR is maintained in the capacity UoM via CR03

  • However, the LEINH field in E1CRCOL (for work center cost data) is populated with the internal standard UoM

This ISO code UOM causes a KAKO UoM error during processing. I'm struggling to understand why there's a difference in how UoMs are handled between the capacity (CRCO) and cost (KAKO) structures, especially since:

  • The outbound and inbound IDoc field values are identical

  • CUNI settings are aligned in both systems

Has anyone experienced similar behavior or can provide detailed technical guidance on resolving this inconsistency?

Any insights would be greatly appreciated.

#ale, #workcenter, #LOIWCS, 

Best regards,

entry.title: Docker ABAP Cloud Developer Trial 2023 Eclipse Project Creation

entry.title: ABAP RAP - Date field value help with future dates disabled?
entry.content:
Hello SAP ABAP RAP Experts,

Is it possible to disable the future dates in the value help of a date field in SAP RAP application?

For example, if today is 22nd July 2025, the value help should show the future dates, i.e. 22nd July onwards as greyed out/disabled and therefore not allowing the user to select future dates.

Just FYI. We are currently handling this requirement based on a validation on save. Is there any other efficient way of handling this?

Thanks!

entry.title: ABAP unit test coverage not work for CONSTRUCTOR
entry.content:
There is some logic in CONSTRUTOR method of my class, So I wrote some unit test for creating instance

1. The unit tests all passed successful, no dump

2. Debugging for the UT can run into break-point of CONSTRUCTOR method.

3. Other instance method UT coverage works good.

the problem is , the UT coverage of CONSTRUTOR method always 0%, anyone met this problem?

UT code like:

CLASS ltd_test DEFINITION FOR TESTING
  DURATION SHORT
  RISK LEVEL HARMLESS
  INHERITING FROM zcl_data.
  PRIVATE SECTION.

    DATA: mo_tool_double TYPE REF TO zif_data_tool.

    METHODS: setup

    METHODS: constructor_test FOR TESTING.

ENDCLASS.

CLASS ltd_test IMPLEMENTATION.

  METHOD setup.
    mo_tool_double ?= cl_abap_testdouble=>create( 'zif_data_tool' ).

  ENDMETHOD.

  METHOD constructor_test .
    cl_abap_testdouble=>configure_call( mo_tool_double )->ignore_all_parameters( )->and_expect( )->is_called_once( ).
    mo_tool_double->get_data(  ).

    DATA lo_c TYPE REF TO zcl_data.

    CREATE OBJECT lo_c 
          EXPORTING io_double = mo_tool_double.


    cl_abap_testdouble=>verify_expectations( mo_tool_double ).
  ENDMETHOD.

ENDCLASS.

entry.title: Issue with Missing Records in CDS Table Function (ABAP 7.50 / HANA)
entry.content:
Hi everyone,

I‚Äôm hoping someone here can help me with a problem I‚Äôm facing.

I‚Äôve been asked to provide data for a report that should show the date of the last document for each customer. I planned to implement this using a CDS view. However, since we are still on ABAP release 7.50, I don‚Äôt have access to the latest CDS View features.

To work around this, I tried using a CDS Table Function to retrieve the data. Unfortunately, I noticed that some records are missing. When I run the same SELECT statement in the SQL Console, I get a result for a specific customer ‚Äì but that same record is not returned by the Table Function.

The data does exist in the underlying tables, so I‚Äôm wondering:
Why is the record not returned by the Table Function?

I‚Äôm aware that there are differences between Open SQL and SQLScript used in Table Functions, but I would have expected the Table Function to return at least the same or more data ‚Äì not less.

We are running ABAP 7.50 on a HANA database.

OpenSQL:

SQLScript:

‚ÄÉ

‚ÄÉ

Any ideas or explanations would be greatly appreciated!

Thanks in advance!

entry.content:
I have developed Root view and on top of which I want to define Projection View, But I encouter error as  E:SDDL_PARSER_MSG:542 PROVIDER CONTRACT 785 , help me to fix this issue. Iam on S4 2020.

@EndUserText.label: 'Projection View for Holiday Block'

@AccessControl.authorizationCheck: #NOT_REQUIRED

@Metadata.allowExtensions: true

@Search.searchable: true

CustomerName1,

}

entry.title: Changing Post Processing in DMEE
entry.content:
Hello SAP Community,

I'm currently working on adapting DMEE format to align with the new ISO 20022 requirements, specifically for the CGI_XML_CT_V9 format. However, I'm encountering a blocking issue related to post processing of empty XML elements in the DMEE tree.

We are implementing the ISO pain 001.001.09 XML format, and during validation, the generated XML file fails.

I attempted to modify the Post Processing settings in the DMEE tree to adjust how empty elements are handled. The goal is to completely remove empty elements.

I followed these instructions: 3480644 - DMEE/DMEEX: XML Empty Element Processing

However, here's the issue:

  • I change the setting, save it, and activate the DMEE tree.

  • But every time I reopen the DMEE tree, the setting reverts back to ‚ÄúDO NOT REMOVE‚Äù ‚Äì the change doesn't persist.

This means my XML output is still invalid, and I cannot move forward with the bank's required format.

Has anyone experienced this rollback issue in the DMEE post processing settings?

 Any guidance would be greatly appreciated. 

Thanks in advance!

entry.title: What happened with Tagging Framework in ABAP?
entry.content:
I've randomly found a mention of Tagging Framework in ABAP Help for 7.4 via Google here. There is very little information about it, just the links to APIs and ODATA. 

The ODATA link is a list of classes that look like classic code-based SEGW implementation. API link is a list of interfaces. Just minimal information about them, no context or examples. However, none of these classes or interfaces exist in our test S/4HANA 2020 system. The SPRO path doesn't exist either.

When searching for "tagging framework" on SAP Help site, I only found the same information listed under ABAP Platform, which should be current. But it's just the same exact text. 

There are no prerequisites listed for this, so I'd assume it should just be included with ABAP platform. But it clearly isn't. Does anyone know what's the deal with this? Is there a prerequisite or an extra solution to purchase?

If you have CL_TFW_ODATA_TAG_DPC or IF_TFW_TAG in your system, where do they belong?

Really curious about this mystery. Thanks!

I am aware that OLE objects cannot be used in a background job.

Nevertheless, I would like to inquire if there are any possible methods to achieve this.

Thank you for your assistance.

Best regards,

Sungmin,

entry.title: When I called BAPI_SALESORDER_CHANGE, "Update was canceled" received from author "CHENG_MR".
entry.content:
When I called BAPI_SALESORDER_CHANGE, the internal table RETURN did not contain any error messages. However, immediately after execution, a popup appeared saying:

"Express document 'Update was canceled' received from author 'CHENG_MR'"

Why did this happen? Below is the code I wrote.

DATA : ls_partner          TYPE bapiparnr,
       lt_return           TYPE TABLE OF bapiret2,
       Lt_PARTNER          TYPE TABLE OF bapiparnr,
       ls_partnerchanges   TYPE  bapiparnrc,
       Lt_PARTNERCHANGES   TYPE TABLE OF bapiparnrc,
       ls_partneraddresses TYPE  bapiaddr1,
       lv_order_header_inx TYPE  bapisdh1x,
       Lt_PARTNERADDRESSES TYPE TABLE OF bapiaddr1.

DATA: lv_adrnr TYPE kna1-adrnr.

SELECT SINGLE adrnr INTO lv_adrnr
  FROM kna1
  WHERE kunnr = '0000001100'.


CLEAR:lt_return,lt_partner.
lv_order_header_inx-updateflag = 'U'.

ls_partner-partn_role  = 'AG'.

ls_partner-partn_numb  = '0000001100'.
ls_partner-country     = 'CN'.
ls_partner-name        = 'laogao'.
ls_partner-postl_code = '112222'.
ls_partner-city       = 'chang'.
ls_partner-street      = '222222'.
ls_partner-telephone   = '1777777777'.
APPEND ls_partner TO lt_partner.
CLEAR:ls_partner.


ls_partnerchanges-updateflag = 'U'.
ls_partnerchanges-document   = '1100000397'.
ls_partnerchanges-itm_number = '000000'.
ls_partnerchanges-partn_role = 'AG'.
ls_partnerchanges-p_numb_old = '0000001100'.
ls_partnerchanges-p_numb_new = '0000001100'.
*ls_partnerchanges-addr_link  = lv_adrnr.
APPEND ls_partnerchanges TO lt_partnerchanges.
CLEAR ls_partnerchanges.

ls_partneraddresses-country = 'CN'.
*ls_partneraddresses-addr_no = lv_adrnr.
ls_partneraddresses-name    = 'ruirui'.
ls_partneraddresses-tel1_numbr  = '16666666666'.
ls_partneraddresses-street  = 'Street'.
ls_partneraddresses-postl_cod2  = '010704'.
APPEND ls_partneraddresses TO lt_partneraddresses.
CLEAR ls_partneraddresses.

CALL FUNCTION 'BAPI_SALESORDER_CHANGE'
  EXPORTING
    salesdocument    = '1100000397'
    order_header_inx = lv_order_header_inx
  TABLES
    return           = lt_return
    partners         = lt_partner
    partnerchanges   = lt_partnerchanges
    partneraddresses = lt_partneraddresses.

CALL FUNCTION 'BAPI_TRANSACTION_COMMIT'
  EXPORTING
    wait = 'X'.


REFRESH:lt_partner,lt_partnerchanges.

entry.title: How to prevent deletion of specific entry in Event 03 (Table Maintenance) when choose multiple rows
entry.content:
Hi experts, I am using Event 03: Before Deleting the Data for my table ZSAP03_EMAIL Now I write this FORM to prevent user from deleting user with USER_ID = DEV-145. When I delete a line with DEV-145 the system works correctly, but when I select multiple lines, including DEV-145 the system deletes DEV-145 as well. Please give me detailed solutions

 

FORM on_delete.
FIELD-SYMBOLS: <fs_user_id> TYPE any.

ASSIGN COMPONENT 'USER_ID' OF STRUCTURE <vim_total_struc> TO <fs_user_id>.

IF sy-subrc = 0 AND <fs_user_id> = 'DEV-145'.

MESSAGE 'Default row DEV-145 cannot be deleted!' TYPE 'E'.
ENDIF.
ENDFORM.
